PROJECT PREPARATORY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE 
 
 
A.  Justification 
1.  The PPTA will build on the work done under ADTA 7024 and prepare an investment 
program, including the technical, financial, economic and social safeguards aspects, and define 
implementation arrangements. Further, it would also explore the feasibility of expanding the 
reach of the investment program by bringing in resources from the FIs and or setting up a 
revolving fund.  
 
B.  Major Outputs and Activities 
2.  The major outputs will be: (i) inception report, (ii) mid-term report comprising sections on 
technical,  economic,  social  and  environmental  aspects,  and  implementation  and  fund  flow 
arrangements, and (iii) a final report including the format of ADB‘s RRP and linked documents.

D.  Consulting Services

sectors, and industrial energy contracting of EE and EC projects in accordance with ADB‘s 
Guidelines on the Use of Consultants (May 2010, amended from time to time). The goods will 
be procured following ADB‘s Procurement Guidelines (April 2010, as amended from time to 
time).

PTL: Project Team Leader 
 
6.  The summary outline terms of references for the PPTA international consultants are 
described in paragraphs 7 to 13 and national consultants in paragraphs 14 to 19.  
 
7.  Team Leader (International, 5 person-months):  Team Leader will coordinate the 
activities  of  other  international  specialists  and  national  experts,  provide  quality  control, 
harmonize proposal and recommendations and will ensure of the participation of stakeholders 
and in building ownership. He/she will be a financial specialist or engineer with at least 20 years 
of experience and knowledge of energy efficiency, and development of investment projects 
relating  to  energy  efficiency,  and  in-depth  understanding  of  ADB  procedures  for  loan 
preparation requirements and processes. The consultant will be responsible for liaising with the 
ADB project officer, ADB Viet Nam Resident Mission, the GoV, FIs and other stakeholders, 
oversee all aspects of project due-diligence and preparation of documents, guide other team 
members, and ensure the quality and timeliness of their outputs. In collaboration with the other 
team members, prepare the draft project administrative manual (PAM) following the sample 
outline provided in Annex and necessary training programs for FIs.  Discuss the same with 
MOF,  MOIT,  MOC,  and  FIs.  This  position  will  help  ADB  project  officer  recruit  necessary 
international  and  national  consultants.  This  position  will  be  responsible  for  all  deliverables 
specified in the table above.  
 
8.  Energy  Efficiency  Specialist  (Cement)  (International,  2  person-months):    The 
international energy efficiency specialist (Cement), under the supervision of the team leader, will 
undertake the following tasks, including the preparation of relevant appendixes and section of  
draft RRP; (i) review the existing report under TA 7024-VIE; (ii) propose necessary energy 
efficiency measures for cement plants, including design aspect, cost estimates of necessary 
equipment and facility, procurement packages and methodology, implementation schedules; 
and (iii) estimate energy savings and reduction in carbon dioxide emission for each plant as a 
result of energy efficiency measures. The consultant will have at least 15 years of experience in 
energy efficiency measures in cement plants, including design aspects, cost estimates and 
procurement aspects.

14  Appendix 4 
9.  Energy  Efficiency  Specialist  (Steel)  (International,  2  person-months):  The 
international energy efficiency project finance and economics specialist, under the supervision 
of the team leader, will undertake the following tasks, including the preparation of relevant 
appendixes and section of  draft RRP; (i) review the existing report under TA 7024-VIE; (ii) 
propose necessary energy efficiency measures for steel plants, including design aspect, cost 
estimates  of  necessary  equipment  and  facility,  procurement  packages  and  methodology, 
implementation schedules; and (iii) estimate energy savings and reduction in carbon dioxide 
emission for each plant as a result of energy efficiency measures..  The consultant will have at 
least 15 years of experience in energy efficiency measures in steel plants, including design 
aspects, cost estimates and procurement aspects.  
 
10.  Project Finance and Economics Specialist (International, 3 person-months): The 
international project finance and economics specialist, under the supervision of the team leader, 
will undertake the following tasks, including the preparation of relevant appendixes and section 
of draft RRP; (i) assess the economic benefits of the project; (ii) identify the risks, and undertake 
appropriate risk and sensitivity analysis with respect to the economic internal rate of return; (iii) 
identify stakeholders, and conduct a distributional analysis of the net project benefits; and (iv) 
with other team members, prepare a project framework that clearly identifies the proposed 
project‘s impact and outcomes.  In terms of financial analyses, the consultant will be guided by, 
and his/her outputs prepared in accordance with ADB's Financial Management and Analysis of 
Projects (the Guidelines). The consultant also will: (i) prepare detailed Project Cost Estimates 
Tables for the proposed sub investments,  (ii) prepare financing plan and identify potential co-
financiers to meet CTF requirements, (iii) conduct in-depth financial analysis of the project, 
including the calculation of the financial internal rate of return (FIRR), net present value (NPV) 
and weighted average cost of capital (WACC) taking into account all the financial revenues and 
costs attributed to the project; (iv) assess the remuneration of the project that will ensure cost 
recovery, and a reasonable return to the developers or estimate any required subsidy for the 
Project  and  its  impact  on  the  government  fiscal  budget;  and  (v)  undertake  a  financial 
management assessment of the EA and IA, including planning and budgetary control, financial 
and management accounting practices and procedures, internal control and auditing.  The 
consultant will have an MBA or an advanced finance qualification and at least 15 years of 
experience in financial and economical analysis of energy projects, including energy efficiency 
in steel and/or cement plants. 
 
11.  Energy  Efficiency  Finance  Specialist  (International,  2  person-months):  The 
international energy efficiency finance specialist, under the supervision of the team leader, will 
undertake the following tasks, including the preparation of relevant appendixes and section of 
draft RRP. The consultant will undertake the following tasks: (i) propose on-lending mechanism 
for EE projects in line with the Decree on on-lending of the government‘s foreign loans dated 14 
July 2010 and role of the Ministry of Industry and Trade and Ministry of Construction, including 
consultation mechanism with FIs; (ii) evaluate risk of FIs for exposing large EE investments 
under given credit limit; (iii) evaluate the prospects for a revolving fund to be set up within MOF 
using ADB loan resources, including the legal, regulatory and institutional issues, and (iv) in line 
with Viet Nam‘s if appropriate, undertake a due –diligence of the MOF to evaluate its capability 
to manage such a Fund, and identify capacity enhancement needs. The consultant will have at 
least 15 years of experience in financing energy efficiency projects in Viet Nam and/or in 
designing the revolving fund for either EE or RE. 
 
12.  Social Specialist (International, 1 person-month): The international social specialist, 
under the supervision of the team leader, will undertake the following tasks, including the 
preparation of relevant appendixes and section of draft RRP; (i) prepare a sample-based social

Appendix 4  15 
 
impact assessment, including gender analysis; and (ii) prepare documents to meet the social 
safeguards  requirements  of  ADB's  Safeguard  Policy  Statement,  and  (iii)  conduct  a  due-
diligence of the existing safeguards systems of the FIs and develop an environmental and social 
management system (ESMS) of FIs to align it with ADB‘s requirements. The consultant will 
have at least 10 years of experience in relevant above tasks. 
 
13.  Environment and Climate Change Specialist (International, 2 person-months): The 
international environmental and climate change specialist, under the supervision of the team 
leader, will undertake the following tasks, including the preparation of relevant appendixes and 
section  of  draft  RRP.  In  accordance  with  the  relevant  ADB  guidelines  and  policies  for 
environmental  assessment  especially  the  Safeguard  Policy  Statement  (June  2009),  the 
Environment  Specialist  will:  (i)  conduct  an  environmental  impact  assessment/initial 
environmental examination (EIA/IEE) of the proposed subprojects considering the likely impacts 
associated with construction activities, as well as the long-term impacts during operation; (ii) 
recommend appropriate environmental mitigation measures for identified significant impacts, 
and  recommend  monitoring  plans  and  cost  estimates  to  address  these  impacts  in  an 
Environmental Management Plan, and (iii)  conduct a due-diligence of the existing safeguards 
systems of the FIs and develop a ESMS to align it with ADB‘s requirements. The specialist will 
also have expertise in climate change aspects of EE and EC projects, especially for the heavy 
industry sector, including UNFCCC rules and CDM methodologies.  The consultant will have at 
least 10 years of experience in relevant above tasks. 
 
14.  Energy Efficiency Expert (Cement) cum Deputy Team Leader) (National, 5 person-
months): The national energy efficiency expert (Cement) will assist the international energy 
efficiency specialist (Cement) for 2 person-months in collecting information on the existing 
report and studies for energy efficiency measures for cement plants and preparing the proposal 
for improvement of energy efficiency.  The consultant will also work as a Deputy Team Leader 
for 3 person-months to assist the International Team Leader in accomplishing his tasks. The 
consultant will have at least 10 years of experience on energy efficiency improvement measures 
in cement industry with a management skill. 
 
15.  Energy Efficiency Expert (Steel) (National, 2 person-months): The national energy 
efficiency  expert  (Steel)  will  assist  the  international  energy  efficiency  specialist  (Steel)  in 
collecting information on the existing report and studies for energy efficiency measures for steel 
plants and preparing the proposal for improvement of energy efficiency. 
 
16.  Energy Efficiency Finance Expert (National, 2 person-months): The national energy 
efficiency  expert  will  assist  the  international  energy  efficiency  finance  expert  in  collecting 
information on the existing on-lending facility and mechanisms in Viet Nam (EIB‘s on-lending 
facility for RE) and legal and regulatory aspects in establishing the revolving fund. The expert 
also reviews the existing credit limit for potential cement and steel companies from FIs. 
 
17.  Social Expert (National, 1 person-month): The national social expert will assist the 
international social specialist in collecting social data in preparing social impact assessment for 
proposed subproject; including gender analysis and social safeguard requirements of ADB‘s 
Safeguard Policy Statement. Also, expect will assess due diligence of the existing safeguard 
systems of FIs and develop necessary ESMS from social aspect. 
 
18.  Environment and Climate Change Expert (National, 3 person-months): The national 
environment and climate change expert will assist the international environment and climate 
change  specialist  in  collecting  environmental  and  climate  change  data  for  the  proposed

16  Appendix 4 
subprojects of respective cement and steel plants.  The expert will assess due diligence of the 
existing safeguard systems of FIs and develop necessary ESMS. Also the expert will assess 
environmental benefit of the proposed subprojects and expected carbon dioxide reduction as a 
result of energy savings. 
 
19.  All national experts, except Deputy Team Leader, should have at least 7 years of 
relevant experience and deep knowledge of national developments in their respective fields. 
Participation in ADB projects or TA projects by other development partners is an advantage. 
 
 
E.  Implementation Arrangements 
20.  MOF will be the EA for the PPTA and the selected FIs will be the IAs. The Ministry of 
Industry  and  Trade  and  Ministry  of  Construction  will  be  consulted  in  identifying  candidate 
companies for steel and cement plants. MOF will provide in-kind contribution for the PPTA in 
terms of counterpart staff time, office accommodation and communication infrastructure, and 
local transport for counterpart staff.   
 
21.  The  proposed  TA  processing  and  implementation  schedule  is  listed  in  Table  A4.4. 
Disbursement will be done according to ADB‘s Technical Assistance Disbursement Handbook 
(2010, amended from time to time).
